name: Payment and security of revenue bonds; revenue bonds not a debt of the State
text: Revenue bonds issued under this part shall be payable solely from and secured solely by the revenues of the office project or projects or office pledged to the payment thereof, and such revenues shall be applied to such payment in accordance with the provisions of this part and the resolution or resolutions authorizing the issuance of the revenue bonds.  No holder or holders of any revenue bonds issued under this part shall have the right to compel any exercise of the taxing power of the State to pay such bonds, or interest thereon.  Each revenue bond shall recite in substance that the bond, including interest thereon, is payable solely from and secured solely by the revenue pledged to the payment thereof, and that the bond does not constitute an indebtedness of the State within the meaning of any limitation of law. [L 1994, c 283, pt of §2(2)]
